intro: Potentilla hirta f. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf cinquefoil, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy on both surfaces. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and rocky slopes. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
